en.title: Testimonial - Quantum Pendant
en.content:
Squash Champion Low Wee Wern .
 

Malaysia Squash Champion; (From left) Low Wee Wern, Nicol David, Sharon Wee and Delia Arnold will be in action at the Women’s World Team Championships in Cairo next week.
I am now playing professional WISPA Tournament. I had to play in the qualifying rounds to get into the main draw. It's very tough to be playing against the world top 30 whom are very experience and fast. I need to put in every effort and energy to keep up the pace and to run for every ball and most importantly, the concentration and focus to fight for every single point.

I wore the Quantum Pendant and drink  the energized water from the flask during training for the last 2 months in Amsterdam, Holland under the well known coach Liz Irving . I did not encounter cramps that I did before during long hours of tough training and during the matches. The pendant and the flask had given me the energy and confidence and against all odds, I qualify for the main draw beating 2 higher experienced player. Each matches was so tough that it's took almost 97 minutes in court to win. Being a junior and to qualify for the main draw in  the recent World Open in England is an achievement  and many thanks to Quantum Science for providing me the energy which plays a vital role for a demanding fast game sports.

LOW WEE WERN CREDENTIALS:

- Asian Junior Individual Championship, Busan, Korea (U-19, 1st, 2008).
- Asian Senior Championship, Kuwait - Team (Women, 1st, 2008).
- Milo All Stars International (U-19, 1st, 2008).
- British Junior Open, Sheffield, England (U-19, 3rd, 2008).
- Dutch Junior Open, Holland (U-19, 1st, 2007).
- Anthony Ricketts Classic Squash Open, Sydney, Australia (U-17, 1st, 2006).
- Pioneer Cup, Cologne, Germany (U-19, 1st, 2006).
